passages.text: Strategic Investment in Al+Cloud & Quick Commerce Bearing Synergy

Following accelerated \(26\%\) yoy growth in cloud revs in FY1Q26, mgmt commented positively that cloud revs growth acceleration is likely to sustain in coming quarters driven by strong demand in Al infrastructure and compute power. The strategic stepped- up investment in quick commerce has translated to encouraging user growth \((+25\%\) yoy in MAU), order frequency, and synergies to CMR and GMV. Mgmt noted CMR is likely to sustain similar growth rate as past two quarters implying around \(10\% +\) yoy despite high base, suggesting positive incremental growth contributed by quick commerce investment. Mgmt targets Rmb1 trillion GMV for quick commerce in three years as it expects its leading average- daily order share position (80mn) to sustain with substantially improvement of UE in next few months. Post estimate revisions, we raise target prices \(+26\% / + 27\%\) to US\\$187/HK\\$183. Maintain Buy on solid Al+Cloud exposure and multiplier effect of synergies between B2C and quick commerce.

Quick commerce — Since starting investment in end- April, BABA shared notable achievements including reaching 120mn peak daily order and weekly average of 80mn in Aug with MAU \(+200\%\) yoy to 300mn. After initial stage of focusing on user growth and building consumer mindshare, the next stage will aim to improve UE as synergies between quick commerce and Taobao materialize with improving user engagement, user traffic, ad revs and CMR growth. We model CMR at \(+10.2\% /10.5\%\) yoy in Sept/Dec Q factoring in slight acceleration in ads despite lapsing high base.

Investment and QC UE — China ecommerce EBITA was \(- 21\%\) yoy to Rmb38.4bn which we reconcile as quick commerce loss likely at Rmb11bn+ for two months of investment. With Jul/Aug investment intensity spike, we estimate QC loss likely to more than double in Sept Q and model ecommerce EBITA to \(- 51\%\) yoy and \(- 43\%\) qoq to Rmb22bn in FY2Q26. With improving delivery density and optimized subsidy approach, mgmt expects UE to substantially narrow in next few months.

Confident in Cloud growth — Strong demand in Al model training and inferencing contributed to \(26\%\) yoy growth in cloud revs this quarter. We model cloud revs at \(+28\% /30\%\) yoy for FY3Q/FY4Q26 with margins stable qoq as mgmt sounded confident on growth acceleration. Three- year Rmb380bn capex budget reiterated.

All reported mixed FY1Q26 with total revenues \(+2\%\) yoy to Rmb247.7bn, \(2 / 2.2\%\) weour estimate/consensus of Rmb252.6/253.2bn.Excluding deconsolidated revenues, like- for- like revenues would have been grown by \(+10\%\) yoy:

Total Alibaba China E- commerce Group \(+10\%\) yoy to Rmb140.1bn, of which CMR \(+10\%\) yoy to Rmb89.3bn; direct sales, logistics and others \(+7\%\) yoy to Rmb29.3bn, quick commerce (Taobao Instant Commerce and Eleme) \(+12\%\) yoy to Rmb14.8bn.
Ali International Digital Commerce Group \(+19\%\) yoy to Rmb34.7bn, vs. our Rmb34.8bn.
Cloud Intelligence Group \(+26\%\) yoy to Rmb33.4bn, vs. our 32.1bn.
All Others \(- 28\%\) yoy to Rmb58.6mn, which includes Freshippo, Cainiao, AliHealth, Hujing DME, Amap, DingTalk, etc.

Non- GAAP NI to ordinary shareholders was \(- 12.4\%\) yoy to Rmb35.3bn, \(10\%\) above our Rmb32.1bn but \(6\%\) below consensus Rmb37.6bn, mainly due to slight revenues miss, higher S&M partly offset by better GPM and lower R&D and G&A. Non- GAAP EPADS was Rmb14.75, vs. our/consensus Rmb13.48/Rmb15.92.
Total adj. EBITDA \(- 11\%\) y/y to Rmb45.7bn, or \(18\%\) margin vs. our estimate of Rmb49.4bn or \(19.6\%\) margin. Total adj. EBITA margin was \(16\%\) vs. \(18.5\%\) a year ago.
Adj. EBITA for Alibaba China E- commerce Group declined \(- 21\%\) yoy with margin decline yoy at \(27.4\%\) vs. \(38\%\) same quarter last year.
EBITA margin for Alibaba International Digital Commerce Group narrowed to \(- 0.2\%\) vs. \(- 13\%\) same quarter last year.
EBITA margin for Cloud Intelligence Group was \(8.8\%\) flat vs. \(+8.8\%\) same period last year, while EBITA margin for All Others at \(- 2.4\%\) vs. \(- 1.3\%\) same period last year.

Alibaba has seen rapid growth in its quick commerce business since launching Taobao Quick Commerce four months ago, with daily peak order volume reaching 120mn & daily average daily orders of 80mn in August, and 300 million monthly active consumers. The quick commerce business is driving significant user growth and engagement on the Taobao app, which is in turn driving incremental revenue growth for Alibaba's e- commerce business through increased advertising and customer management revenue.

With a leading market position, Baba is focused on rapidly improving operating efficiency to narrow the gap with the food delivery industry's leader. Baba expects to reduce UE losses by half in the short term. 1) While new user acquisition requires upfront investment, strong user retention means increasing repeat customers will improve UE. 2) Increasing the proportion of high- value meal orders

and non-food category orders will boost average order value and thus UE. 3) After an initial investment to handle a 4x order volume surge and address delivery capacity shortages in July and August, logistics costs are expected to decline as order scale stabilizes, further improving UE.

In the long- term, Alibaba expects quick commerce to add Rmb1 trillion in annualized GMV to its platform within the next three years. In the long- term, Alibaba believes it can achieve industry- leading efficiency as order density increases, according to management. Baba believes the shift to multi- platform competition in food delivery benefits merchants and consumers by offering more choice. Baba is committing financial resources to create over 1 million direct jobs, drive industry transformation, and stimulate consumption and the broader economy.

Alibaba has been investing in the consumption market for a long time, including in user acquisition and supply chain development for its Taobao, Tmall, and other consumption- focused businesses. The Rmb50bn investment in quick commerce is an incremental investment on top of these ongoing efforts.

This quarter, CMR experienced strong and positive growth, primarily due to an increased take rate. This surge in take rate was largely attributed to two factors: the implementation of the software service fee and the expanding adoption of the Al- powered Quanzhantui system. Looking ahead, these elements are projected to continue boosting CMR. Additionally, Quick Commerce is expected to contribute to CMR growth by increasing user numbers and purchase frequency, which will further enhance the take rate. Therefore, a continued growth momentum in CMR is anticipated for the next few quarters, according to management. We model CMR to \(+10.2\% /10.5\%\) yoy in Sept/Dec Q factoring slight acceleration in ads despite lapsing high base.

Baba emphasizes that the rapid success of Taobao Quick Commerce is largely attributable to years of prior investment in Ele.me. Despite market share fluctuations, Ele.me significantly advanced its infrastructure and capabilities, providing the essential foundation that allowed Taobao Quick Commerce to quickly service 120 million orders, rather than building from scratch.

This foundational strength is crucial, as a successful quick commerce operation demands sufficient merchants, delivery capacity, and consumers. By integrating Ele.me's robust merchant base and logistics system with Taobao's vast and active user base, Baba has established a powerful ecosystem for its quick commerce endeavors.

Baba's investment strategy for quick commerce is not standalone; it's a holistic approach designed to generate incremental positive benefits for the entire e- commerce business across short, medium, and long terms, according to management.
In June quarter, Cloud Intelligence Group revenue reached Rmb33.4bn, \(+26\%\) yoy, primarily driven by public cloud revenue growth, including increasing adoption of Al- related products.

Al- related revenue maintained triple- digit yoy growth for the eighth consecutive quarter, with increasing demand for compute, storage and other public cloud services to support Al adoption. Ali will continue to invest in anticipation of customer growth and technology innovation, including Al products and services to increase cloud adoption of Al and maintain market leadership.

Management noted as Ali continued to strengthen Al model capabilities, there are more new Al applications to be developed with more new use cases. Meanwhile, many vendors started to leverage large model and use Al- run original functions and workloads which also drives strong cloud demand.

In recent quarters, management noted fast growth in inference workload with continued growth in training and inference with rising training requirements especially in auto, education and multimedia applications. Management also saw new opportunities for companies to leverage open- source models and Alibaba Al infrastructure to perform post- training and model fine- tuning.

Regarding cloud margin trend, management observed an increasing level of market concentration in China comparing to overseas market given higher demand for full- stack comprehensive capabilities. Management believes AliCloud is better positioned with complete capabilities across traditional cloud computing, compute, storage, Al compute and Al models within a developer- friendly ecosystem.

Management reiterated its goal to maintain growth rate above market growth rate to increase market share by growing number of users, expanding into new use cases, and therefore not in short- term on increasing gross margin. We model cloud revenues at \(+28\% /30\%\) yoy for FY3Q/FY4Q26 with margins stable qoq as management sounded confident on growth acceleration.
For Al capex, Ali will continue to implement three- year plan to invest Rmb380bn on cloud and Al with qoq fluctuation going forward.

Management saw the evolution path from simple chatbots towards Al agent development. This may require large context windows for model to be able to undertake more complex tasks with longer chains of thoughts as agents are required to utilize multiple tools or chains of tools, creating new opportunities for Ali as an infrastructure provider to provide virtual services, simultaneous browser window opening, mobile virtual machines and sandbox environment.

AliCloud is supporting numerous customers in different sectors with a new product called AgentBay that provides a sandbox environment specifically for agents. In order to differentiate from other products, management believes the model's coding capabilities will become important to connect with different other tools and enterprise internal systems. Similarly, these models are able to solve many tasks within the enterprise or sophisticated tasks on consumer side.

Lastly, AliCloud also offers quite a few products that can tie to the Alibaba ecosystem which is important for ecommerce enterprises customer to further synergize with Taobao, DingTalk, Amap and Alipay to provide automated solutions at business level. Through these tools, enterprises can develop Al agents to solve various tasks within the enterprise.

Given huge historic opportunities for Al and opportunities to transform consumption from ecommerce to hyperlocal ecommerce and instance commerce, management will continue to invest in these areas under substantial investments leveraging resources in cash reserve, operating cash flows, and other resources across the balance sheet.

Management believe they have sufficient resources to make these substantial investments. Management will be mindful to balance short- term and long- term return and make clear priority to drive positive return such as accelerated growth for cloud business in multiple quarters going forward.

In terms of quick commerce investment, so far Ali did not make any money from those investments in instant commerce, but management has seen clear integration of instant commerce into Taobao app to drive increasing traffic, usage frequency, and ad revenues stream on the platform.

With the progression from ecommerce to instant commerce, all these investments may likely drive good returns. Management is confident that with sufficient resources on hand, Ali will prioritize in more valuable investments to balance short- term and long- term returns.

We adjusted our revenues/non- GAAP profit for FY2026E- 28E by \(- 0.9\% / - 9.0\%\) \(+1.6\% / + 7.4\%\) and \(+3.6\% / + 32.7\%\) , factoring actual FY1Q26 results and management comments on cloud accelerated growth, and the CMR momentum and investment in instant commerce business, etc.

We model FY2026 total revenues at \(4.5\%\) yoy to Rmb1,041bn and adj. net profit of Rmb117.8bn. We forecast group adj. EBITA to Rmb129.4bn and China ecommerce group adj. EBITA to Rmb125.1bn or \(22.6\%\) margins for FY2026E.

Post estimates revisions, our new sum- of- the- parts based target prices increase by \(+26\%\) / \(+27\%\) to US\$187/HK\$183 from US\$148/HK\$144.

Alibaba China E- commerce Group: We assign target multiple at 12x P/E on FY2026E profit. Assigning 12x P/E on FY2026E profit yield an estimated valuation of US\$204bn or US\$86per ADS or HK\$84per share. We use a higher target multiple of 12x (from our previous 10x) to reflect more optimistic outlook from CMR revenue growth comments driven by quick commerce synergy.

Cloud Intelligence Group: We assign a 5x P/S multiple on FY26E revenue of Cloud Intelligence Group. Our 5x multiple is based on slight discount to global peer, and indicates valuation at US\$106bn, or US\$45/share and HK\$44 per share.

Alibaba International Digital Commerce Group (AIDC): We assign a 3.0x P/S multiple on FY26E revenue of AIDC Group. Our 3.0x multiple is in line with global peers, and indicates valuation at US\$65bn, or US\$28/share and HK\$27 per share.
All others: We assign 1.5x P/S multiple. Assigning 1.5x to adjusted consolidated revenues of US\$36.3bn indicates valuation at US\$54.4bn or about US\$23 per share or HK\$22 per share.
30% discount on net cash: To be in line with our SOTP for other internet peers, we apply a 30% discount and yield a US\$5.9per ADS or HK\$5.7per share.
In total, our SOTP derives a fair value at US\$443bn or US\$187 per ADS or HK\$183 per H- share.
Figure 3. Alibaba-Sum of the Parts

Alibaba was founded in 1999. In the years since, Alibaba has created one of the world's leading internet e- commerce companies with an online ecosystem for buyers, sellers, third- party service providers, third- party payments, and strategic partners. The company was listed on the NYSE in September 2014 and completed its secondary listing in Hong Kong in November 2019.

We rate Alibaba H- shares as Buy. We are positive on Alibaba given: i) it has the leading online commerce ecosystem in China (combined \(80\%\) market share in C2C and B2C segments); ii) its monetization rate has upside potential; iii) synergies can be harvested across marketplaces, leveraging big data analysis, and AliCloud infrastructure; and iv) growth opportunities beckon in China's rural cities and globally.

Our target price for Alibaba H- shares of \(\mathsf{HK}\Phi 183\) is based on \(12xP / E\) on FY2026E Ecommerce Group net profit, \(5xP / S\) on FY2026E Cloud Intelligence Group revenue, \(3.0xP / S\) on AlDC Group revenue, \(1.5xP / S\) on all other businesses. Our target multiples are benchmarked against comps. We also assign a \(30\%\) discount to net cash position, in- line with our SOTP for other internet peers. Our SOTP fair value comes to \(\mathsf{HK}\Phi 183\) per H- share.

Key downside risks that could prevent the shares from reaching our target price include: (i) failure in executing its new retail strategy; ii) investment spend and margins pressure become worse than expected; iii) slowdown of user traffic and online GMV and losing appeal to brands & merchants; iv) integration risks for newly acquired entities; v) slowdown of the Chinese and global economies and overhang of US- China or other trade disputes; and vi) regulatory risks on poor product quality and integrity of merchants.

Alibaba was founded in 1999. In the years since, Alibaba has created one of the world's leading internet e- commerce companies with an online ecosystem for buyers, sellers, third- party service providers, third- party payments, and strategic partners. The company was listed on the NYSE in September 2014 and completed its secondary listing in Hong Kong in November 2019.
We rate Alibaba N- shares as Buy. We are positive on Alibaba given: i) it has the leading online commerce ecosystem in China (combined \(80\%\) market

share in C2C and B2C segments); ii) its monetization rate has upside potential; iii) synergies can be harvested across marketplaces, leveraging big data analysis, and AliCloud infrastructure; and iv) growth opportunities beckon in China's rural cities and globally.

Our target price for Alibaba N- shares of US\$187 is based on 12x P/E on FY2026E Ecommerce group net profit, 5x P/S on FY2026E Cloud Intelligence Group revenue, 3.0x P/S on AIDC Group revenue, 1.5x P/S on all other businesses. Our target multiples are benchmarked against comps. We also assign a 30% discount to net cash position, in- line with our SOTP for other internet peers. Our SOTP fair value comes to US\$187 per share.

Key downside risks that could prevent the shares from reaching our target price include: (i) failure in executing its new retail strategy; ii) investment spend and margins pressure become worse than expected; iii) slowdown of user traffic and online GMV and losing appeal to brands & merchants; iv) integration risks for newly acquired entities; v) slowdown of the Chinese and global economies and overhang of US- China or other trade disputes; and vi) regulatory risks on poor product quality and integrity of merchants.

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of 15% or more or 25% or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "—" and "—" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re- establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short- term volatility

or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds \(15\%\) against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.

The proportion of all Citi Research research recommendations that were the equivalent to "Buy", "Hold", "Sell" at the end of each quarter over the prior 12 months (with the % of these that had received investment firm services from Citi in the prior 12 months shown in brackets) is as follows: Q2 2025 Buy \(33\%\) (63%), Hold \(44\%\) (51%), Sell \(23\%\) (49%), RV 0.4% (86%); Q1 2025 Buy \(33\%\) (63%), Hold \(44\%\) (51%), Sell \(23\%\) (49%), RV 0.5% (87%); Q4 2024 Buy \(32\%\) (64%), Hold \(44\%\) (52%), Sell \(23\%\) (44%), RV 0.4% (92%); Q3 2024 Buy \(33\%\) (61%), Hold \(44\%\) (52%), Sell \(23\%\) (49%), RV 0.4% (80%). For the purposes of disclosing recommendations other than for equity (whose definitions can be found in the corresponding disclosure sections), "Buy" means a positive directional trade idea; "Sell" means a negative directional trade idea; and "Relative Value" means any trade idea which does not have a clear direction to the investment strategy.

European regulations require a 5 year price history when past performance of a security is referenced. CitiVelocity's Charting Tool (https://www.citvilecity.com/cv/2/#go/CHARTING_3_Equities) provides the facility to create customisable price charts including a five year option. This tool can be found in the Data & Analytics section under any of the asset class menus in CitiVelocity (https://www.citvilecity.com/). For further information contact CitiVelocity support (https://www.citvilecity.com/cv2/go/CLIENT_SUPPORT). The source for all referenced prices, unless otherwise stated, is DataCentral, which sources price information from Thomson Reuters. Past performance is not a guarantee or reliable indicator of future results. Forecasts are not a guarantee or reliable indicator of future performance.

Citi Research broadly and simultaneously disseminates its research content to the Firm's institutional and retail clients via the Firm's proprietary electronic distribution platforms (e.g., Citi Velocity and various Global Wealth platforms). As a convenience, certain, but not all, research content may be distributed through third party aggregators. Clients may receive published research reports by email, on a discretionary basis, and only after such research content has been broadly disseminated. Certain research is made available only to institutional investors to satisfy regulatory requirements. The level and types of services provided by Citi Research analysts to clients may vary depending on various factors such as the client's individual preferences as to the frequency and manner of receiving communications from analysts, the client's risk profile and investment focus and perspective (e.g. market- wide, sector specific, long term, short- term etc.), the size and scope of the overall client relationship with the Firm and legal and regulatory constraints.

These opinions may not fit to your financial status, risk and return preferences. For this reason, to make an investment decision by relying solely to this information stated here may not bring about outcomes that fit your expectations. Furthermore, Citi Research is a division of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the "Firm"), which does and seeks to do business with companies and/or trades on securities covered in this research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the Firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report, however investors should also note that the Firm has in place organisational and administrative arrangements to manage potential conflicts of interest of this nature.

Securities recommended, offered, or sold by the Firm: (i) are not insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation; (ii) are not deposits or other obligations of any insured depository institution (including Citibank); and (iii) are subject to investment risks, including the possible loss of the principal amount invested. The Product is for informational purposes only and is not intended as an offer or solicitation for the purchase or sale of a security. Any decision to purchase securities mentioned in the Product must take into account existing public information on such security or any registered prospectus. Although information has been obtained from and is based upon sources that the Firm believes to be reliable, we do not guarantee its accuracy and it may be incomplete and condensed. Note, however, that the Firm has taken all reasonable steps to determine the accuracy and completeness of the disclosures made in the Important Disclosures section of the Product. The Firm's research department has received assistance from the subject company(ies) referred to in this Product including, but not limited to, discussions with management of the subject company(ies). Firm policy prohibits research analysts from sending draft research to subject companies. However, it should be presumed that the author of the Product has had discussions with the subject company to ensure factual accuracy prior to publication. Statements and views concerning ESG (environmental, social, governance) factors are typically based upon public statements made by the affected company or other public news, which the author may not have independently verified. ESG factors are one consideration that investors may choose to examine when making investment decisions. All opinions, projections and estimates constitute the judgment of the author as of the date of the Product and these, plus any other information contained in the Product, are subject to change without notice. Prices and availability of financial instruments also are subject to change without notice. Notwithstanding other departments within the Firm advising the companies discussed in this Product, information obtained in such role is not used in the preparation of the Product. Although Citi Research does not set a predetermined frequency for publication, if the Product is

a fundamental equity or credit research report, it is the intention of Citi Research to provide research coverage of the covered issuers, including in response to news affecting the issuer. For non- fundamental research reports, Citi Research may not provide regular updates to the views, recommendations and facts included in the reports. Notwithstanding that Citi Research maintains coverage on, makes recommendations concerning or discusses issuers, Citi Research may be periodically restricted from referencing certain issuers due to legal or policy reasons. Where a component of a published trade idea is subject to a restriction, the trade idea will be removed from any list of open trade ideas included in the Product. Upon the lifting of the restriction, the trade idea will either be re- instated in the open trade ideas list if the analyst continues to support it or it will be officially closed. Citi Research may provide different research products and services to different classes of customers (for example, based upon long- term or short- term investment horizons) that may lead to differing conclusions or recommendations that could impact the price of a security contrary to the recommendations in the alternative research product, provided that each is consistent with the rating system for each respective product.
